Traversal
public class SimpleTraversal
extends java.lang.Object
implements Traversal

A simple traversal that traverses Nodes in a prefix order.

Author:
Gary Buyn

Method Detail

getBacktracksToNextNode

public int getBacktracksToNextNode()

Retrieves the number of backtracks required to get to the next Node.

A backtrack is an upward movement in the graph being traversed. An additional backtrack is performed at the end of a traversal to move above back to the root. This ensures that the number of backtracks performed is equal to the number of downward movements performed including the initial downward movement to the root when getNextNode() is first called.

Returns:
The number of backtracks required to get to the next Node.

getNextNode

public Node getNextNode()
Description copied from interface: Traversal

Retrieves the next Node in this traversal.

Specified by:
getNextNode in interface Traversal
Returns:
The next Node in this traversal or null if there are no more Nodes to be returned.

hasMoreNodes

public boolean hasMoreNodes()
Description copied from interface: Traversal

Determines if there are more Nodes to be retrieved by this traversal.

Specified by:
hasMoreNodes in interface Traversal
Returns:
True if a Node will be retrieved by the next call to getNextNode(), false otherwise.

reset

public void reset()
Description copied from interface: Traversal

Resets this traversal so that the next Node retrieved is the root Node of the graph.

Specified by:
reset in interface Traversal
